intro: Galactia tashiroi f. yaeyamensis, commonly known as the Yaeyama galactia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Yaeyama Islands of Japan. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. It thrives in coastal and limestone habitats, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
